an5.228:4.1: “Mendicants, there are these five drawbacks for a family who takes their meals late in the day.
an5.228:4.3: When guests visit, they are not served on time.
an5.228:4.4: The gods who accept spirit-offerings are not served on time.
an5.228:4.5: Ascetics and brahmins who eat in one part of the day, abstaining from eating at night and from food at the wrong time are not served on time.
an5.228:4.6: Slaves, workers, and servants do their duties neglectfully.
an5.228:4.7: A meal eaten during the wrong period is not nutritious.
an5.228:4.8: These are the five drawbacks for a family who takes their meals late in the day.
an5.228:5.1: There are these five benefits for a family who takes their meals at a proper time.
an5.228:5.3: When guests visit, they are served on time.
an5.228:5.4: The gods who accept spirit-offerings are served on time.
an5.228:5.5: Ascetics and brahmins who eat in one part of the day, abstaining from eating at night and from food at the wrong time are served on time.
an5.228:5.6: Slaves, workers, and servants do their duties attentively.
an5.228:5.7: A meal eaten during the proper period is nutritious.
an5.228:5.8: These are the five benefits for a family who takes their meals at a proper time.”
